title: Tell me Riot what is actually wrong with allowing 5 bans?
body:
Why can't we have 5 bans one ban pick for each person? That literally makes no sense. I feel like you guys have just ignored this idea constantly, and I don't see any exploits in it. So why won't/can't you do this?

Edit: I'd like to thank all of you for your inputs. This issue has been brought up multiple times within the League community, and since I've never really seen a Riot post saying why this wouldn't work, and so I wanted the communities opinion on this.

That being said, I don't think this idea could work in our current circumstances, it seem possible at first, but there would have to be too many changes to make the system work, and I'm pretty sure that's why it's stayed as is, but I still feel this idea could possibly have it's chances to work in the future.

Extra Edit: It's not really going to work for the fact that you can ban out the entire god tier top lane, but if more champions were god tier it would prevent this from happening, and that's the point I was trying to make with champ diversity, and having more champions in god tier makes the game a bit more diverse, but since only 3 or 4 champions are extremely good top they can easily be banned out.

Again thank you all!

-Champ select will take longer (this can probably be fixed though)
-The amount of champions required to play ranked rises.

Especially since people often are in disagreement over what champions are deserving of "permaban" status. Maybe it's just in low ELOs, but bans are all over the map in my ranked matches.

Plus, if you're playing a champion who's currently "OP" then you already have to accept that you may very well not get to play them and so you should have back-up plans. I'm under no delusions that if I were to play ranked now for the first time in nearly a month that I'd have a good chance at playing Ekko, for example, and I'm okay with that.

> [{quoted}](name=LoLKiru,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=m3IIJlkB,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-06-20T23:58:45.567+0000)

That would only be true if each champion was just a downgrade of the best champion.  In a perfect world where each champion has their own niche, this would never happen. And that's what patches are for.

There's actually a compelling reason for not increasing the bans that Riot's never brought up: Because if you increase the number of bans each team gets, you increase the number of champions required to play Draft Mode (which is very relevant at the lower levels, and also punishes smurfs in ranked). 

With 2 more bans on each side, that increases the number of champions required to play Draft from 16 to 20, and that is not nothing. Given that the average IP cost of a champion is 3150, that's quite a few extra weeks' worth of playing before you can start Drafting. Not to mention, what about players who are currently playing Draft and Ranked, but then Riot all of a sudden says "Sorry, you need four more champions because we're increasing the number of bans!" 

It's punishing new players and players who are still getting used to the game, which Riot definitely does _not_ want to do.

To play Devil's Advocate: Shouldn't we be a bit more harsh on who gets to play in a more competitive environment? Remember, it's not just you in there. When you go into Draft and Ranked, you're expected by your team to have a decent handle on your various lane matchups and mechanics. So with that extra time that the ban increase would enforce should give them more time, whether they like it or not, to practice their mechanics and matchups in a less stressful environment making their actual entry into the more competitive field less stressful for both them and their teammates. It is completely possible to enter into Ranked too early, and I've seen it done a lot. 

And also, about those smurfs: They're smurfs. I don't hate them, but unlike new players who could easily get in over their head by jumping into ranked/draft too early, they know exactly what they're in for ahead of time. It won't stymie a good 95% of smurfs I've ever heard about.

Not saying I support a ban increase, not saying I don't. However, there are two sides to every argument that could be made about anything to do with a ban increase. It's kind of a touchy subject.
